properties.name: Able Hakuba Goryu
properties.address: 22184-10 Kamishiro, Hakuba, Kitaazumi District, Nagano 399-9211, Japan
properties.description: Able Hakuba Goryu is a popular ski resort located in the northern part of the Nagano Prefecture, Japan. It is linked with Hakuba 47 Winter Sports Park, providing extensive skiing and snowboarding opportunities for all skill levels. The resort boasts several runs, spreading across three peaks. It is known for its fantastic powder snow and varied terrain that caters to beginners, intermediates, and advanced skiers. The resort also features ski schools, rental shops, restaurants, and accommodation options, making it a comprehensive destination for winter sports enthusiasts. Beyond the slopes, visitors can enjoy stunning views of the surrounding mountains and forests, offering a unique blend of sports and nature.

properties.name: Afton Alps
properties.address: 6600 Peller Ave S, Hastings, MN 55033, USA
properties.description: Afton Alps is a popular ski resort located in the scenic St. Croix River Valley, Minnesota, USA. It is renowned for its expansive terrain, offering a diverse range of 48 trails across 300 acres. Catering to all levels of skiers and snowboarders, the resort features runs for beginners, intermediate and advanced levels, plus a terrain park for those seeking an adrenaline rush. Afton Alps also includes luxurious facilities such as dining options, equipment rentals, a ski school, and charming chalets for relaxation. During the summer, the resort transforms into a haven for hiking and mountain biking. Overall, Afton Alps is a comprehensive resort combining snow sports and panoramic natural beauty.

properties.name: Alpine Valley
properties.address: 10620 Mayfield Rd, Chesterland, OH 44026, USA
properties.description: Alpine Valley Ski Area is a ski resort in Munson Township, Geauga County, Ohio, east of Chesterland. Located in Ohio's snow belt, it receives the most natural snowfall of any Ohio ski resort. The resort offers 9 trails, a terrain park, and night skiing, catering to all skill levels.

properties.name: Alta
properties.address: 10010 Little Cottonwood Canyon Rd, Alta, UT 84092, USA
properties.description: Alta Ski Resort is a renowned skiing destination located in the Wasatch Mountains at Little Cottonwood Canyon, Utah. This resort is a paradise for skiing enthusiasts and is known for receiving heavy snowfall, averaging around 547 inches annually, providing fantastic snow conditions. Alta boasts over 2,600 acres of skiable terrain, offering 116 runs that cater to all ski levels, from beginners to advanced. The ski resort prises itself on maintaining a traditional skiing atmosphere, hence it does not allow snowboarding. It has rustic, yet comfortable, lodgings and offers amenities like ski lessons, equipment rentals, mountain tours and a variety of dining options. Down-to-earth and focused on the sport rather than luxury, Alta Ski Resort is adored by many due to its challenging terrain, reliable snow, and old-school charm.

properties.name: Alyeska
properties.address: 1000 Arlberg Ave, Girdwood, AK 99587, USA
properties.description: Alyeska Resort, nestled in Girdwood, Alaska, is approximately 40 miles south of Anchorage and stands as Alaska's premier skiing and snowboarding destination. Known for its impressive steep terrain and a generous snowpack, it offers some of the most exhilarating slopes in North America. The mountain showcases an array of terrains catering to all skill levels. With over 1,600 skiable acres, every skier or snowboarder, be it a novice or an expert, can find a trail that suits them. Alyeska boasts a summit elevation of 3,939 feet and an impressive vertical drop of 2,500 feet, making it one of the continent's most remarkable ski resorts. One of its key advantages is its northern location, ensuring it receives an average annual snowfall of over 650 inches. This abundant snow guarantees a long ski season, usually spanning from November to April, with many delightful powder days. However, Alyeska is not just about skiing. The resort provides top-tier amenities, including an array of dining choices, a spa, and the Hotel Alyeska, conveniently located at the base. This hotel provides guests with direct slope access and a tram journey up the mountain. What truly sets Alyeska apart is its awe-inspiring backdrop. Gazing out, visitors are treated to panoramic views of the Turnagain Arm, surrounding glaciers, and the majestic Chugach Mountains. Beyond its winter appeal, Alyeska and its vicinity offer an assortment of year-round activities, from mountain biking to glacier tours. And for those visiting during the colder months, the possibility of witnessing the entrancing dance of the Aurora Borealis or Northern Lights adds another layer of allure to this Alaskan gem.

properties.name: Andermatt-Sedrun
properties.address: Andermatt-Sedrun Sports AG, Bahnhofplatz 3, 6490 Andermatt, Switzerland
properties.description: Andermatt-Sedrun is a prominent ski resort located in the heart of the Swiss Alps. Covering two valleys, it provides a combination of over 120 kilometers of ski slopes, making it the largest ski area in Central Switzerland. The resort features a mix of beginner, intermediate, and advanced runs and boasts some of the country's most challenging off-piste skiing. Andermatt-Sedrun also affords visitors with breathtaking panoramic mountain views and a variety of alpine accommodation options. Besides winter sports, the resort offers hiking, mountain biking, and golf during the summer months. Its location is easily accessible from major Swiss cities making it an ideal destination for both day trips and longer stays.

properties.name: Arapahoe Basin
properties.address: 28194 US-6, Dillon, CO 80435, USA
properties.description: Arapahoe Basin is a popular ski resort located in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado, just 68 miles west of Denver. Known for its breathtaking views and high elevation, the resort offers skiing and snowboarding opportunities across its 1,400 acres of skiable terrain. Arapahoe Basin is also renowned for its long ski season, often starting in October and extending through June or even July. The resort provides a variety of terrain difficulty levels, making it suitable for both beginners and experienced skiers. It also features several restaurants and shops, ensuring a variety of dining and shopping options for visitors. It lacks on-site lodging which keeps it less crowded and more appealing to dedicated skiers and snowboarders. Arapahoe Basin is particularly known for "The Beach," a stretch along the early rise area where visitors set up grills and picnic tables for tailgate-style parties.

properties.name: Aspen Highlands
properties.address: 199 Prospector Rd, Aspen, CO 81611, USA
properties.description: Aspen Highlands is a renowned ski resort nestled in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado, USA. Famous for its stunning panoramic views and exhilarating slopes, this resort is a favorite destination for both amateur and professional skiers. It offers more than 1,000 acres of skiable terrain, with slopes ranging from beginner to advanced levels, including the iconic Highland Bowl. Premium facilities such as ski schools, equipment rentals, and comfortable lodgings are available for guests. Beyond skiing, visitors can enjoy a variety of winter activities like snowboarding, snowshoeing, and aprs-ski entertainment. The resort area also boasts upscale dining options and retail stores. Despite its sophisticated offerings, Aspen Highlands maintains a down-to-earth atmosphere, reflecting its original spirit as a ski area built by and for the locals.

properties.name: Aspen Mountain
properties.address: 601 E Dean St, Aspen, CO 81611, USA
properties.description: Aspen Mountain, also known as Ajax, is a famous ski resort located in the Rocky Mountains, in the city of Aspen, Colorado. This resort includes over 675 acres of skiable terrain with a top elevation of 11,212 feet. It is known for its challenging slopes and lack of beginner runs, catering primarily to intermediate and advanced skiers. Aside from its skiing facilities, Aspen Mountain also offers high-end dining and shopping options, making it a popular destination also for non-skiers. The mountain boasts a Gondola that transports visitors from the city to the top, offering stunning panoramic views of the surrounding snow-capped peaks. Its vibrant nightlife and cultural events contribute to the glamour and excitement that this resort offers all year round.

properties.name: Attitash
properties.address: 775 US-302, Bartlett, NH 03812, USA
properties.description: Attitash Mountain Resort is a popular ski destination located in the White Mountains of New Hampshire, USA. Known for its diverse terrain, it offers 68 trails spread across two connected peaks - Attitash and Bear Peak. The resort caters to a plethora of skill levels, making it a perfect destination for both beginners and seasoned experts. In addition to downhill skiing and snowboarding, the resort offers a range of winter activities, such as snowshoeing, a downhill mountain coaster, and a zipline. The resort is also equipped with modern amenities like a ski school, equipment rental facilities, dining options, and lodging facilities. The picturesque setting and the friendly atmosphere truly make Attitash Mountain Resort a coveted winter sports destination. During the off-season, the area remains active with mountain biking, hiking, and other outdoor activities.

properties.name: Banff Sunshine
properties.address: 1 Sunshine access Rd, Banff, AB T1L 1J5, Canada
properties.description: Banff Sunshine Village is a popular ski resort located in the heart of the Canadian Rockies, inside the boundaries of Banff National Park in Alberta, Canada. It offers more than 3,300 acres of skiable terrain spread across three mountains, with a varied mixture of runs that cater to beginners, intermediates, and advanced skiers and snowboarders. With one of the longest ski seasons in North America, it offers high-quality snow and consistently cold temperatures. The resort is famous for its breathtaking panoramic views, boasting some of the most beautiful landscapes in North America. It also provides ski-in and ski-out accommodation at the Sunshine Mountain Lodge, Canada's only entirely ski-in ski-out hotel. The resort facilities include rental shops, ski schools, cafes, and restaurants. Access to the resort is through an impressive 20-minute gondola ride up the mountain, making it a unique destination for winter ski and snowboard enthusiasts.

properties.name: Bear Mountain
properties.address: 43101 Goldmine Dr, Big Bear Lake, CA 92315, USA
properties.description: Bear Mountain, also known as "The Park," is a renowned ski resort located in Southern California's San Bernardino Mountains. Besides skiing, it also offers snowboarding facilities across all skill levels. Spread across 200 acres, the resort contains more than 120 beginner to advanced terrain features including jumps, jibs, and the region's only Superpipe. The peak elevation is about 8,805 feet, with a vertical drop of 1,665 feet making for exhilarating rides down the slopes. A range of lessons and rental equipment are available on site, as well as several food and beverage options for aprs-ski. The resort features a bustling social scene with events throughout the ski season. It's a top destination for winter sports enthusiasts both for its excellent snow conditions and its spectacular mountain views.

properties.name: Beaver Creek
properties.address: 210 Beaver Creek Plaza, Beaver Creek, CO 81620, USA
properties.description: Beaver Creek Resort is a world-class ski destination located in Avon, Colorado, USA. It is famous for its well-groomed ski runs, stunning mountain views, and luxurious amenities. The resort spans over 1,800 acres and offers more than 150 trails suitable for beginner, intermediate, and experienced skiers. Boasting 23 ski lifts, the resort ensures seamless transportation around the mountain. Beaver Creek is divided into three distinct areas: the main Beaver Creek Village, the quiet Bachelor Gulch, and the family-friendly Arrowhead. It's renowned for hosting various skiing competitions, including the annual Birds of Prey Men's World Cup. Along with skiing, it provides opportunities for snowboarding, snowshoeing, and ice skating. The resort features a range of accommodation, from luxury lodges to private condos, renowned fine-dining restaurants, and an array of shops and boutiques. Its commitment to guest service includes unique touches like complimentary freshly-baked cookies served at the end of the ski day.

properties.name: Big Boulder
properties.address: 434 Jack Frost Mountain Rd, White Haven, PA 18661, USA
properties.description: Big Boulder is a popular ski resort located in Lake Harmony, Pennsylvania. The resort, which boasts 55 acres of skiable land, is renowned for its impressive diversity of trails and terrain parks, designed to cater for both beginners and expert skiers and snowboarders. It offers a total of 16 trails, the longest of which is 2100 feet. The resort is also equipped with 8 lifts that ensure swift rides to the top of the slopes. Night skiing is available on all trails, allowing skiers to enjoy the stunning winter scenery under the stars. In addition to skiing and snowboarding, Big Boulder offers tubing for those looking for a fun, less demanding winter sport. The resort offers ski and snowboard rentals as well as lessons for all ages and skill levels. For relaxation and refreshments, visitors can enjoy the onsite bar and restaurant.

properties.name: Big Sky
properties.address: 50 Big Sky Resort Rd, Big Sky, MT 59716, USA
properties.description: Big Sky Resort is a world-class ski resort located in southern Montana in the Rocky Mountains. Known as the "Biggest Skiing in America," it offers over 5,800 acres of skiable terrain with a vertical drop of 4,350 feet. The resort features two towering mountains, Lone Peak and Andesite Mountain, with a wide variety of slopes catering to ski and snowboard enthusiasts of all skill levels, from beginners to experts. It includes 300 named runs, 4 terrain parks, and a vast expanse of off-piste skiing. Big Sky Resort is also acclaimed for its high-speed chairlifts and gondolas, which minimize waiting time. Apart from winter sports, the resort offers year-round activities such as mountain biking, golf, ziplining, and scenic lift rides. Lodging options range from hotels and condos to cabins and vacation homes. The resort also hosts several bars, restaurants, and shopping outlets, providing a vibrant aprs-ski scene.

properties.name: Blue Mountain
properties.address: 190 Gord Canning Dr, The Blue Mountains, ON L9Y 3Z2, Canada
properties.description: Blue Mountain Ski Resort is a popular destination in Ontario, Canada, known for its stunning views, thrilling winter sports activities, and high-quality facilities. Located near the shores of Georgian Bay, it offers a variety of terrains for everyone from beginners to expert skiers and snowboarders. The resort features 42 trails on 364 skiable acres, and 16 ski lifts ensuring minimal waiting time. Beyond skiing and snowboarding, the resort also offers snowshoeing, tubing, and ice skating in winter. During the summer, activities such as mountain biking, golf, zip-lining, and hiking are popular. Blue Mountain Ski Resort is not just about outdoor activities; it also presents a range of lodging options, restaurants, and shops in its pedestrian-only village. The resort also offers conference facilities, making it an attractive choice for corporate events. It is a perfect getaway for those who appreciate outdoor adventures in all seasons.

properties.name: Boston Mills
properties.address: Boston Mills:, 7100 Riverview Rd, Peninsula, OH 44264, USA
properties.description: Located in Ohio, the Boston Mills Ski Resort is a top-notch skiing destination offering a variety of winter activities. Though compact in size, Boston Mills is well-equipped with diverse terrains suitable for skiers and snowboarders of all levels. Its 79 acres of skiable area includes seven lifts, several runs of different difficulty levels, two terrain parks, and a vertical drop of 264 feet. The resort offers ski and snowboard lessons for beginners, and rental equipment is available on site. Night skiing is also a popular option here, making the fun continue even after sundown. The resort also features a cozy lodge where guests can relax and enjoy food and drinks. Boston Mills Ski Resort is not just about skiing, it's about having a memorable winter adventure.

properties.name: Boyne Mountain
properties.address: 1 Boyne Mountain Rd, Boyne Falls, MI 49713, USA
properties.description: Boyne Mountain is a premier ski resort located in Boyne Falls, Michigan. This resort is well-known for its wide range of winter activities including skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing, cross-country skiing, and tubing. With over 60 trails and 415 skiable acres, Boyne Mountain accommodates all skill levels from beginners to advanced skiers. The resort also has twelve lifts, including high-speed chairlifts, designed to transport guests quickly and comfortably to the top of the slopes. Aside from winter sports, the resort offers amenities such as accommodations, a variety of dining options, spa services, and an indoor water park. Established in 1948, Boyne Mountain has a rich skiing history and continues to be a leading destination for winter sports enthusiasts.

properties.name: Brandywine
properties.address: Boston Mills:, 7100 Riverview Rd, Peninsula, OH 44264, USA
properties.description: Brandywine is a ski resort located in Sagamore Hills, Ohio, offering winter fun for families and ski enthusiasts. It provides a number of ski and snowboarding slopes to cater to all levels of difficulty, from easy beginner slopes for those just learning to advanced runs for experienced skiers. The resort also offers night skiing and snowboarding, making it an ideal destination for those who want to experience the thrill of the slopes under the starry sky. Besides slopes, Brandywine offers snow tubing options for a fun, fast-paced winter activity that requires no particular skill level. The resort is equipped with a ski rental shop, ski school, lodge with food and beverages, and a fireplace for warming up. It's also known for having friendly, helpful staff and maintaining well-groomed, safe trails.

properties.name: Breckenridge
properties.address: 1599 Ski Hill Rd, Breckenridge, CO 80424, USA
properties.description: Breckenridge Ski Resort is a world-class skiing destination located in Breckenridge, Colorado, USA. Set in the Rocky Mountains, it boasts an elevation of 13,000 feet, making it one of the highest ski resorts in the country. The resort offers four peaks spread across 2,908 acres with over 187 ski trails, catering to skiers and snowboarders of all skill levels. It's renowned for its consistent snowfall, high-quality snow, and diverse terrain, which includes steeps, bowls, and the country's highest chairlift. Breckenridge is not just a winter destination, but also offers year-round activities like hiking, mountain biking, and fly-fishing. The town itself is historic, featuring Victorian architecture, a lively nightlife, and a variety of restaurants and shops.

properties.name: Brighton
properties.address: Brighton Resort, 8302 S Brighton Loop Rd, Brighton, UT 84121, USA
properties.description: Brighton Ski Resort is situated in Big Cottonwood Canyon, Utah. ItÕs known to be one of the oldest skiing/boarding resorts in the country since it started operations in the 1930s. Brighton offers around 1,050 acres of skiable terrain with 66 trails, and it's well-suited for all types of skiers and snowboarders, from beginners to advanced. The resort is also popular because it offers night skiing with over 200 acres of lighted trails. Brighton is recognized for its consistent snowfall, with over 500 inches annually, providing excellent snow conditions. Facilities at the resort include ski & snowboard schools, equipment rental, lodges, and dining options. Brighton is also appreciated for its natural, laid-back vibe, and impressive mountain views.

properties.name: Buttermilk
properties.address: 38700 CO-82, Aspen, CO 81611, USA
properties.description: Buttermilk is a renowned ski resort located in Aspen, Colorado, and is best known for hosting the Winter X Games and Red Bull Double Pipe events. Although it has a reputation as a premier destination for freestyle snowboarders and skiers, Buttermilk is also a family friendly resort with plenty of runs suitable for beginners and intermediates. The terrain is divided into three areas: Main Buttermilk, West Buttermilk and Tiehack. Main and West Buttermilk primarily cater to beginner and intermediate skiers, while Tiehack offers more advanced runs. The resort features a total of 44 trails served by 8 lifts. The resort is also home to the Hideout, an innovative children's center that aids young learners in their skiing and snowboarding journey. Buttermilk is part of the Aspen Snowmass, a collection of four ski areas owned and operated by the Aspen Skiing Company.

properties.name: Chamonix
properties.address: Chamonix, France
properties.description: Chamonix is a world-renowned ski resort located in the Rhne-Alpes region of southeastern France. Nestled at the foot of Mont Blanc, it is known for its picturesque landscapes, exceptional skiing conditions, and its lively town atmosphere. The resort features extensive ski runs that cater to all skill levels from beginners to seasoned experts. Chamonix is not only famed for its downhill skiing, but also for off-piste and cross-country skiing. The town itself is packed with a variety of accommodation options, eateries serving delectable cuisines, high-end shops, and a vibrant nightlife scene. This resort is also a year-round destination, offering activities like hiking, rock climbing, and paragliding during summer months. The unique blend of natural beauty, thrilling winter sports, and lively social scene make Chamonix a top choice for a skiing holiday.

properties.name: Copper Mountain
properties.address: 209 Ten Mile Cir, Frisco, CO 80443, USA
properties.description: Copper Mountain is a popular ski resort located in Summit County, Colorado. This alpine ski resort offers over 2,490 acres of skiing and snowboarding terrain, including back bowls and expert hike-to terrain. Known for its naturally divided slopes, it offers varied terrain suitable for all levels, from beginners to experienced skiers and snowboarders. It features a pedestrian-friendly village that offers lodging options, restaurants, shops, and nightlife. Additional amenities include ski and snowboard lessons, equipment rentals, and a tubing hill. During the summer, Copper Mountain transforms into a hub of outdoor activities such as mountain biking, hiking, and zip-lining. There's also a golf course that offers picturesque mountain views. Copper Mountain is not just a resort, but a comprehensive year-round mountain experience.

properties.name: Coronet Peak
properties.address: Coronet Peak Ski Area, Queenstown 9371, New Zealand
properties.description: Coronet Peak is a popular ski resort located in the South Island of New Zealand. It is well-known for its diverse range of slopes that cater to both beginners and advanced skiers. The resort boasts of an advanced snowmaking system that ensures good snow quality throughout the ski season. It offers modern facilities including a fully licensed restaurant, equipment rental services, and ski and snowboard lesson programs. One unique feature of Coronet Peak is its night ski events, where skiers and snowboarders can enjoy the slopes under the starry sky. Being just a short drive from Queenstown, Coronet Peak offers majestic views of the Southern Alps and Lake Wakatipu, making it a favorite destination for snow sport enthusiasts and nature lovers alike.

properties.name: Crans-Montana
properties.address: Crans-Montana, 3963, Valais, Switzerland
properties.description: Crans-Montana is a prestigious ski resort in the canton of Valais, Switzerland, perched on a sun-drenched plateau above the Rhône Valley. It offers 140 km of ski runs with elevations reaching nearly 3,000 meters, providing stunning panoramic views of the Alps. The resort is known for hosting FIS Alpine Ski World Cup events.

properties.name: Crested Butte
properties.address: Crested Butte, CO 81224, USA
properties.description: Crested Butte Mountain Resort is a popular skiing destination located in southwestern Colorado. It sits just outside the historic town of Crested Butte, known for its quaint charm and lively artistic scene. The resort boasts over 1,500 acres of skiable terrain with a variety of runs suitable for beginners, intermediate, and advanced skiers and snowboarders. Crested Butte's slopes are renowned for their extreme terrain, featuring steep runs, well-groomed trails, and a plethora of backcountry options. The resort also offers multiple other winter activities such as snowshoeing, cross-country skiing, and snowmobiling. Off the slopes, visitors can enjoy high-quality lodges, numerous dining options, and a range of wellness facilities. With its spectacular Rocky Mountain views, Crested Butte provides a unique and unforgettable alpine experience.

properties.name: Crotched
properties.address: 615 Francestown Rd, Bennington, NH 03442, USA
properties.description: Crotched Mountain Ski and Ride is a charming ski resort located in the rural community of Bennington, southern New Hampshire. Known for its diverse terrain, it caters to both beginner and advanced skiers and snowboarders. This resort boasts 25 trails serviced by 5 lifts, providing a balance of easy, intermediate and challenging slopes. It is renowned for its "Midnight Madness" event, which allows late-night skiing until 3 am on selected nights. Crotched Mountain is also home to an extensive snowmaking system that guarantees reliable snow conditions throughout the season. Additional facilities include a fully equipped rental shop, a ski school, and a comfortable lodge with a restaurant and bar. It is a family-friendly destination with a dedicated area for children's programs.

properties.name: Crystal Mountain
properties.address: 33914 Crystal Mountain Blvd, Enumclaw, WA 98022, USA
properties.description: Crystal Mountain is the largest ski resort in Washington state, located in the Cascade Range southeast of Seattle. With 2,600 skiable acres and over 80 runs, it offers diverse terrain for all abilities. The resort features stunning views of Mount Rainier and is known for its excellent powder snow.

properties.name: Cypress
properties.address: 6000 Cypress Bowl Rd, West Vancouver, BC V7V 3N9, Canada
properties.description: Cypress Mountain Ski Resort is located in West Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. Known as the host venue for the freestyle skiing and snowboarding events of the 2010 Winter Olympics, it offers world-class facilities and breathtaking views. It features 53 individual downhill runs serviced by 6 chairlifts and 2 surface lifts, catering to a variety of skill levels from beginners to seasoned skiers and snowboarders. The resort provides options for night skiing and snowboarding, and also operates a popular snow school for all ages. It is the biggest vertical rise ski area in Vancouver and provides terrain for cross-country skiing, snow shoeing and snow tubing as well. Amenities include several eateries, rental options, and a retail shop. The stunning panoramic views of Vancouver, Howe Sound and the Pacific Ocean make Cypress Mountain a unique and unforgettable skiing destination.

properties.name: Deer Valley
properties.address: 2250 Deer Valley Dr S, Park City, UT 84060, USA
properties.description: Deer Valley Resort is a prestigious, high-end ski resort located in Park City, Utah. Known for its elite services and luxury amenities, it features finely groomed slopes, upscale dining, and lavish lodging options. It has more than 2,000 acres of skiable terrain, over 100 trails, and a vertical drop of 3,000 feet, providing a variety of exciting runs for beginners to advanced skiers. Deer Valley is also one of the few remaining ski resorts in North America that prohibit snowboarding. It has gained recognition for its impeccable guest services, including the provision of ski valets and complimentary Mountain Host tours. This resort also played host to several events during the 2002 Winter Olympics. Deer Valley truly provides a premier skiing experience with its attention to detail and commitment to guest satisfaction.

properties.name: Eldora
properties.address: Eldora, CO 80466, USA
properties.description: Eldora is a quaint ski resort located in Colorado, just about 21 miles from Boulder. It's a much-cherished location due to its proximity to Denver, allowing skiers and snowboarders to avoid the usual weekend traffic common at other resorts. Eldora offers a fantastic mix of terrain, with trails suited for beginners, intermediates, and experts. The resort has a total of 680 acres of skiable terrain, 53 trails, and 10 lifts. From its location, you can enjoy stunning panoramic views of the Continental Divide. Besides downhill skiing and snowboarding, Eldora also offers cross-country skiing and snowshoeing. It's also home to a ski and ride school and provides options for equipment rental. The resort is known for its sustainable practices, running on 100% renewable electricity. Overall, Eldora is a well-loved ski resort that offers a convenient, varied, and eco-friendly skiing experience.

properties.name: Falls Creek
properties.address: Falls Creek VIC 3699, Australia
properties.description: Falls Creek is an alpine ski resort in the Northeast region of Victoria, Australia. It is the largest ski resort in the state and is renowned for its excellent services and friendly atmosphere. The resort boasts over 450 hectares of skiable terrain with a variety of runs suitable for beginners, intermediate and advanced skiers. Falls Creek features a ski-in, ski-out pedestrian village, which adds to its charm and convenience for visitors. It also offers top-notch facilities including ski schools, equipment rentals, restaurants, and accommodation options. In addition to winter sports like skiing and snowboarding, the resort also offers activities like snow biking, snow tubing, and cross-country skiing. During the summer months, visitors can enjoy fishing, hiking and mountain biking.

properties.name: Fernie
properties.address: Fernie, BC, Canada
properties.description: Fernie Alpine Resort is a popular ski resort located in the Canadian Rocky Mountains of southeastern British Columbia, near the town of Fernie. It is known for its impressive snowfall status with an average of 30 feet annually. The resort offers a varied terrain spread over 2,500 acres, catering to different skill levels from beginners to expert skiers and snowboarders. It features 142 designated tracks, five bowls and tree skiing zones. The slope side amenities include a range of accommodations, eateries, bars and a ski school. Fernie Alpine Resort has not only established itself as a winter haven but also provides summer activities like mountain biking, zip lining and hiking. The picturesque setting and friendly atmosphere make Fernie Alpine Resort a favourite among many visitors.

properties.name: Grandvalira
properties.address: El Tarter, AD100 Canillo, Andorra
properties.description: Grandvalira is the largest ski resort in the Pyrenees and Southern Europe, located in the Eastern valley of Andorra. It offers over 210 km of marked ski slopes, making it an ideal destination for skiers and snowboarders of all levels. The resort is well-equipped with modern facilities, including high-speed chair lifts, gondolas, and snow cannons to ensure optimal skiing conditions. There are seven sectors - Encamp, Canillo, Tarter, Soldeu, Grau Roig, Pas de la Casa, and Peretol. Grandvalira also offers a range of other winter activities like snowmobiling, dog sledding, and snowshoe walking. This resort features several restaurants and accommodation options, from luxury hotels to cozy cabins.

properties.name: Hakuba 47
properties.address: 24196-47 Kamishiro, Hakuba, Kitaazumi District, Nagano 399-9211, Japan
properties.description: Hakuba 47 is a popular ski resort located in the Northern Alps of Hakuba village, Nagano Prefecture, Japan. Renowned for its extensive vertical drop and long groomed runs, it offers an exhilarating skiing experience for skiers and snowboarders of all skill levels. The resort is connected with Hakuba Goryu Ski Resort, providing visitors access to a vast variety of slopes and trails. It features modern facilities such as a gondola, high-speed quad lifts, a terrain park, as well as several restaurants and cafes. Hakuba 47 is also famous for its spectacular panoramic views of the surrounding alpine scenery. The resort typically opens from late November to early May, providing excellent snow conditions due to its high-altitude location.

properties.name: Hakuba Cortina
properties.address: 12860-1 Chikuniotsu, Otari, Kitaazumi District, Nagano 399-9422, Japan
properties.description: Hakuba Cortina Ski Resort is a popular skiing destination located in Hakuba village, Nagano Prefecture, Japan. It is surrounded by spectacular mountain landscapes and famous for its heavy snowfall, often having the deepest snow base in the Hakuba valley. Hakuba Cortina offers a diversity of terrain that caters to all levels of skiers and snowboarders, from beginners to experts. The resort features various facilities including ski rental, ski school, accommodations, restaurants, and hot springs. The main language spoken is Japanese, but English is also used. It is renowned for its off-piste and tree skiing, offering a unique thrill for experienced skiers. Hakuba Cortina is not just a winter destination, as it also offers summer activities such as hiking, horse riding, and golf. The resort exudes a traditional Japanese charm, providing a unique cultural experience for foreigners.

properties.name: Hakuba Happo-One
properties.address: Hokujo, Hakuba, Kitaazumi District, Nagano 399-9301, Japan
properties.description: Hakuba Happo-One is a premier ski resort located in the northern region of the Japanese Alps, known for its stunning natural beauty and panoramic mountain views. Often acclaimed for hosting a number of events during the 1998 Winter Olympics, the resort offers 13 different slopes and 16 lifts designed to cater to skiers of all levels. Known for its extensive ski terrain, the resort boasts around 1,000 acres of skiable area that includes groomed trails, ski parks, mogul runs, and wooded areas for free-style skiing. Hakuba Happo-One also offers an impressive altitude difference of over a kilometer, ensuring long, thrilling runs. Besides skiing, it offers a range of winter activities such as snowboarding, snowmobiling, and cross-country skiing. properties.name: Hotham

properties.name: Jackson Hole

properties.name: June Mountain

properties.name: Kicking Horse

properties.name: Killington

properties.name: Kimberley

properties.name: Kitzski

Providing mountainous views amidst the alpine charm and the legendary Austrian hospitality, Kitzski is a dream destination for any skiing enthusiast.

properties.name: Lake Louise

This ski resort is known for its panoramic views, striking mountain peaks, glaciers, and deep powder snow. Lake Louise Ski Resort boasts over 145 marked ski runs and back bowls on four mountain faces. The amenities at the resort include various dining options, ski and snowboard lessons, rentals, and a range of accommodations nearby. The breathtaking natural beauty and the high-quality ski facilities make Lake Louise a popular choice for winter sports enthusiasts from all over the world.

properties.name: Laurel

Known for its challenging terrain and stunning views, the resort caters to skiers and snowboarders of varying skill levels.

Surrounded by the tranquil beauty of the Laurel Mountain State Park, visitors can also enjoy snowshoeing and cross-country skiing. properties.name: Mammoth

properties.name: Mt Hutt
